course.subject: ENTR
course.name: Industrial Landscape: Understanding the Elements to Start a Business
course.description: This course is jointly run by the Schools of Engineering, Science and Business & Management. It acquaints students with the landscapes of various industries, by examining important elements to start up a business and introducing the markets of various sectors. The goal is to expose students interested in entrepreneurship to the diversity, competition, interaction and decision-making process of various ecosystems. Professors and visitors from the schools will discuss enabling technologies, key processes, business models, and cases on topics of current interests. Students form teams to survey and analyze the companies and ecosystem of a particular sector, in order to identify the operation models, similarities, differentiations and opportunities ahead.

reviews.author: toxicboi
reviews.title: Monotonous but Rewarding
reviews.comment_content:
This is basically a seminar-based course, where every week there will be a guest speaker, who has been involved in startups and entrepreneurship, comes and speaks on different topics related to it. Some are fun, but it can get quite monotonous at times, as you only have to sit and listen.

It is a good starting point to know about entrepreneurship and making contacts in the industry.

There is also a trip to Science Park which is interesting.

In the end, you have to form a group and come up with a startup idea, and then present it in class with a working prototype.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Personally, if the speakers were more interactive with the audience, and there were more hands-on learning approach to the course, I would have really enjoyed it.
The professor is very eccentric and knowledgeable and can definitely help/invest if you have an idea.
reviews.comment_grading:
Lesson reflections 30%
Basically, you have to write a reflection on how the guest speakers lecture was relevant, whether you have any personal opinions on the content, and also summarise it a bit - be careful of the word limit, it is quite less compared the information they require from us so you need to be smart in writing it.

Group Project Report (30%)

Group Presentation (20%)

Peer evaluation (10%)

Course Participation (10%)
Simple attendance gives you this grade.

I ended up getting an A, probably didn't get A+ because we exceeded the time limit for presentation.
reviews.comment_workload: Very minimal workload mostly. In the end can get a little hectic as you have to write the report, and prepare the presentation. But if you have good group members, it wont be a problem.

reviews.author: Nicola
reviews.title: Very flexible and interesting course
reviews.comment_content: Guest lecturer(s) are invited to speak twice a week every week. Each bring very interesting insights related to starting a business/ how to relate different industries to startups.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is done in a non-traditional way where you learn through discussion with the professor and the guests.
reviews.comment_grading:
30% Lesson reflections
10% Course participation
30% Group projects report 3000 words
20% Group presentation 20 minutes including Q&A  
10% Peer evaluation
reviews.comment_workload:
A ~300 words reflection after (almost) each guest speaker session.

A startup project in which the professor really encourages the building of a prototype, whatever the idea is and if applicable.
